What is Newton's first law of motion?
Answer: An object at rest stays at rest| and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction| unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.
Distractor1: For every action| there is an equal and opposite reaction.

Answer: The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it.

Distractor2: Every object in a state of uniform motion tends to remain in that state of motion unless an external force is applied to it.

What is Coulomb's law?
Answer: The force between charges is directly proportional to the product of the charges and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

Distractor2: Every object in a state of uniform motion tends to remain in that state of motion unless an external force is applied to it.
